Authors: KURNIAWAN Y., LUHUKAY D., JOHAN, BHUTKAR G.
Title: Analysis of monitoring information system for production facilities support and agricultural business capital
Source title: Journal of Theoretical and Applied Information Technology
Affiliations: Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Centre of Excellence in HCI, Vishwakarma Institute of Technology, Pune, India
Authors with affiliations: KURNIAWAN, Y., Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; LUHUKAY, D., Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; JOHAN, Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; BHUTKAR, G., Centre of Excellence in HCI, Vishwakarma Institute of Technology, Pune, India
Abstract: The results of the analysis of the running system shows that the problems faced by the organization today is tracking of realization and development information for the aid of production facilities and capital of agricultural business that has not been optimal. The purpose of this study is to analyse the needs of systems that support the implementation of aid monitoring. The information system of monitoring and evaluation of production facilities is considered to be the most appropriate to implement the strategy, as well as to overcome the problems occurring in the Ministry of Agriculture in relation to monitoring and evaluation of production facilities and agricultural business capital. The information system of monitoring and evaluation of production facilities and agricultural capital is an internet-based system to facilitate the Central Team (Minister of Agriculture and Technical Team of Directorate General), Provincial Agriculture Development Team, and Technical Team of Regency or Municipality Agriculture Office to access realization and development information for accurate agricultural business aid without being limited by space and time. © 2005 - ongoing JATIT & LLS.

Authors: Kurniawan Y., Setiawan S., Bhutkar G., Johan, Cabezas D.
Title: Instagram engagement for university
Source title: Proceedings of 2020 International Conference on Information Management and Technology, ICIMTech 2020
Affiliations: School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Information Systems Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Centre of Excellence in HCI, Vishwakarma Institute of Technology, Pune, India; Interdepartamental Center Embedded, Systems of Automation and Computing, Peter the Great St. Petersburg Polytechnic University, St. Petersburg, Russian Federation
Authors with affiliations: Kurniawan, Y., School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Information Systems Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Setiawan, S., School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Information Systems Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Bhutkar, G., Centre of Excellence in HCI, Vishwakarma Institute of Technology, Pune, India; Johan, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Information Systems Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Cabezas, D., Interdepartamental Center Embedded, Systems of Automation and Computing, Peter the Great St. Petersburg Polytechnic University, St. Petersburg, Russian Federation
Abstract: Social media is used as an online communication today. In addition, institutions, schools, and companies make social media as a part of media marketing to introduce their brands. Instagram will be discussed in this study because the majority I-Generation in Indonesia used Instagram. Universities use Instagram for marketing media by posting photos and videos with captions. Besides posting, the engagement between users and university social media accounts is very important for marketing purpose. In this research, we will learn about how much user engagement to university social media in Indonesia. The purpose of this research is to identify user's opinion about university Instagram official accounts and to analyze the engagement of five top universities official Instagram account in Indonesia with Analisa.io tool and questionnaire survey for one university as a case study. The result of this study can be used as advice or input about social media engagement for university official Instagram account. © 2020 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Analysis; Engagement; Marketing; Social media; University
Index Keywords: Commerce; Information management; Social networking (online); Surveys; Indonesia; Marketing media; On-line communication; Questionnaire surveys; Social media; User engagement; Marketing

Authors: Kurniawan Y., Johan, Bhutkar G., Berlian A.R.K., Tando G.S.C., Fahira D., Daventa S., Angeline E.
Title: Does the existence of connected transport mobile application affect transjakarta passengers?
Source title: Proceedings of 2020 International Conference on Information Management and Technology, ICIMTech 2020
Affiliations: School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Information Systems Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Centre of Excellence in HCI, Vishwakarma Institute of Technology, Department of Computer Engineering, Pune, 411037, India
Authors with affiliations: Kurniawan, Y., School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Information Systems Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Johan, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Information Systems Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Bhutkar, G., Centre of Excellence in HCI, Vishwakarma Institute of Technology, Department of Computer Engineering, Pune, 411037, India; Berlian, A.R.K., School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Information Systems Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Tando, G.S.C., School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Information Systems Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Fahira, D., School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Information Systems Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Daventa, S., School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Information Systems Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Angeline, E., School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Information Systems Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: Transjakarta has been the most dependable public transportation for the citizens in Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia, in order to get rid off the traffic and air pollution which nowadays have become the daunting challenges in the Capital. During 16 years of service in fulfilling the citizens' need of transportation, Transjakarta is considered to have a fairly good performance, remarked with the addition of 13 corridors until renovation of the bus fleets. In the era of Jakarta Smart City, Transjakarta is now available at citizens' service. The connected transport application (X), which was renowned as the official partner for Jakarta Smart City, is a route-finding application which can be downloaded freely in the citizen smartphone. It has some features which facilitates the users in gaining the information about Transjakarta, such as locating the station nearby, navigating bus position, and looking at bus schedule. X itself, is already implemented in the transportation system of four big cities in Europe (Berlin, London, Prague, and Vilnius). To investigate whether the existence of this application really affects Transjakarta passengers, we have performed a survey-based research by visiting the largest and the busiest Transjakarta station at Harmoni, in the capital. The Transjakarta passengers are interviewed to get an information about how effective X in providing information about Transjakarta. As the result of this research, the respondents are divided into three groups: those who know X and using it, those who know X, but don't use it, and those who don't know about X at all. © 2020 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Connected transport; Indonesia; Mobile application; Passengers; Transjakarta
Index Keywords: Information management; Smart city; Bus fleets; Indonesia; Mobile applications; Public transportation; Route findings; Survey-based research; Transport applications; Transportation system; Buses

Authors: Kurniawan Y., Johan, Bhutkar G., Alfarrel J.F., Theo R.R., Alex, Denanto R.K., Putra Nangka T.P., Jericho I.
Title: Unlocking student's preference on two BINUS mobile learning management system
Source title: Proceedings of 2020 International Conference on Information Management and Technology, ICIMTech 2020
Affiliations: School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Information Systems Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Centre of Excellence in HCI, Vishwakarma Institute of Technology, Department of Computer Engineering, Pune, 411037, India
Authors with affiliations: Kurniawan, Y., School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Information Systems Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Johan, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Information Systems Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Bhutkar, G., Centre of Excellence in HCI, Vishwakarma Institute of Technology, Department of Computer Engineering, Pune, 411037, India; Alfarrel, J.F., School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Information Systems Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Theo, R.R., School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Information Systems Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Alex, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Information Systems Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Denanto, R.K., School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Information Systems Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Putra Nangka, T.P., School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Information Systems Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Jericho, I., School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Information Systems Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: Many universities in the World have their own unique way for informing their students. The methods may vary for each university, but most of the modern universities today use a Learning Management Systems (LMS). The LMS application is widely used by the lecturers and students of Bina Nusantara University called BINUMAYA. The system was originally created as a website application, but now its mobile version is also available and is widely used by amongst the students and the lecturers. However, the existing student version of the mobile application have two separate applications, that function almost identically with the official BINUMAYA system. We are interested in finding out the students' perceptions about the two applications. Therefore, we ran a user survey on BINUS students that were randomly selected by convenience sampling. Respondents were asked several questions related to performance, trustworthiness and preferability using the applications. The data collected was analysed using the two mean difference tests for each variable. Our findings showed that the students have a few reasons on why they prefer to choose one application compared to the other and, why they only trust the information presented by the official mobile LMS. © 2020 IEEE.
Author Keywords: E-Learning; Learning Management System; Mobile LMS; Student Preference
Index Keywords: Information management; Students; Learning management system; Mean difference test; Mobile applications; Mobile Learning; User surveys; Learning systems

Title: The Impact of Knowledge Management System in Hospital
Source title: Proceedings of 2019 International Conference on Information Management and Technology, ICIMTech 2019
Affiliations: Information Systems Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Kurniawan, Y., Information Systems Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Johan, Information Systems Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Sudiana, Information Systems Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: The purpose of this study is to examine the effect of the knowledge management (KM) system on the hospital services performance. The hospital located in DKI Jakarta (Indonesia) that has implemented the KM system as a pilot project is the population of this research. Where the respondents are medical personnel at the hospital. This study analyzes the correlation between the use of KM systems and the performance of hospital services, using independent-samples T-tests and ANOVA tests from SPSS and R Commander programs to prove the hypothesis of the two variables, namely the use of KM systems (capabilities) and hospital services performance. The results of this research have succeeded in proving that there are significant differences between medical personnel who rarely use the KM system and who often use it, with those who often have a greater level of service performance. Thus, it can be concluded that the KM system used by hospital has a positive effect seen in the performance of medical personnel. © 2019 IEEE.
Index Keywords: Knowledge based systems; Knowledge management; Personnel; Hospital service; Independent samples t tests; Km systems; Knowledge management system; Level of Service; Medical personnel; Pilot projects; services performance; Hospitals

Authors: Madyatmadja E.D., Abdurachman E.D.I., Gaol F.L., Pudjianto B.W., Johan
Title: Features in social media-based e-government application: A hope from society desire
Source title: ICIC Express Letters, Part B: Applications
Affiliations: Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jl. K. H. Syahdan No. 9, Palmerah, Kemanggisan, Jakarta  11480, Indonesia; Computer Science Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jl. K. H. Syahdan No. 9, Palmerah, Kemanggisan, Jakarta  11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Madyatmadja, E.D., Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jl. K. H. Syahdan No. 9, Palmerah, Kemanggisan, Jakarta  11480, Indonesia, Computer Science Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jl. K. H. Syahdan No. 9, Palmerah, Kemanggisan, Jakarta  11480, Indonesia; Abdurachman, E.D.I., Computer Science Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jl. K. H. Syahdan No. 9, Palmerah, Kemanggisan, Jakarta  11480, Indonesia; Gaol, F.L., Computer Science Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jl. K. H. Syahdan No. 9, Palmerah, Kemanggisan, Jakarta  11480, Indonesia; Pudjianto, B.W., Computer Science Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jl. K. H. Syahdan No. 9, Palmerah, Kemanggisan, Jakarta  11480, Indonesia; Johan, Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jl. K. H. Syahdan No. 9, Palmerah, Kemanggisan, Jakarta  11480, Indonesia
Abstract: Social media has entered the government sector as a platform to do public service activities. Government has spent a lot of time, money, and sources to improve the public service but there are always challenges to improve public interest in using social media-based e-government applications. Web 2.0 and social media provide opportunities to user that is the community, stakeholders, and service providers to discuss and share opinions about features regarding people’s expectations. This study involved 349 people as end users and 10 service providers in producing e-government features based on social media according to their expectations. Society as application’s user was asked to see the current quality of social media-based e-government services based on end users. This aimed to conduct evaluations so that they could propose features for the development of social media-based e-government application. © 2019, ICIC International. All rights reserved.
Author Keywords: E-government; Features; Public service; Social media

Authors: Johan, Kurniawan Y., Sudiana, Cabezas Tapia D.F.
Title: The Influence of Knowledge Management Capabilities on Hospital Services Performance
Source title: Proceedings of 2018 International Conference on Information Management and Technology, ICIMTech 2018
Affiliations: Information Systems Department, Systems Bina Nusantara University, School of Information, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Peter the Great St. Petersburg Polytechnic University, Interdepartmental Center of Embedded Systems of Automation and Computer Sciences, Russian Federation
Authors with affiliations: Johan, Information Systems Department, Systems Bina Nusantara University, School of Information, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Kurniawan, Y., Information Systems Department, Systems Bina Nusantara University, School of Information, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Sudiana, Information Systems Department, Systems Bina Nusantara University, School of Information, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Cabezas Tapia, D.F., Peter the Great St. Petersburg Polytechnic University, Interdepartmental Center of Embedded Systems of Automation and Computer Sciences, Russian Federation
Abstract: Currently healthcare is one of the main problems in Indonesia, particularly with the primary care provided by hospitals. Problems that often occur at hospitals in Indonesia was shown from the high malpractice rate in Indonesia, this problem made public confidence to the hospital was decline, this is indicated by the increasing number of Indonesian citizens who choose to seek the treatment at the hospital in neighboring countries. The suspected problems related to the knowledge management capability of the hospital. This study aims to reveal the role of knowledge management capabilities on the performance of hospital services and provide a prototype system that can improve the knowledge management capabilities of the hospital. The sample for this study are hospitals located in Jakarta. Where the respondent is the head of the hospital. The research method that will be used in this research is qualitative and quantitative method. This research generated a framework strategy to improve knowledge management capability at hospital by looking at factors influencing knowledge management capability of hospital in Indonesia, especially Jakarta. © 2018 IEEE.
Author Keywords: hospital; knowledge management capability; services performance
Index Keywords: Hospitals; Hospital service; Indonesians; Knowledge management capabilities; Primary care; Prototype system; Quantitative method; research methods; services performance; Knowledge management

Title: Mobile application business plan to assist travel planning
Source title: Proceedings of 2017 International Conference on Information Management and Technology, ICIMTech 2017
Affiliations: Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Sanjaya, L.S., Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Ferdianto, Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Titan, Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Johan, Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: The mobile application business plan was intended to solve the problem often faced by travelers in planning their trip. This business plan includes development of the business model, mobile application with proposed features, and also its financial sustainability plan. In this paper, the authors use methods such as Business Model Canvas, Five Forces Analysis by Porter, and Financial Analysis include Return of Investment (RoI), Internal Rate of Return (IRR), and Payback Period. The mobile application will complement the business plan with the proposed features such as trip suggestion and other supporting features (hotel, restaurant, tour spot, news, and tourism event). © 2017 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Business; Mobile Application; Planning; Tourism; Travel

Authors: Johan, Kurniawan Y., Jingga F., Limantara N.
Title: Development Business Process Simulation for Supporting Learning Activities (A Case Study Approach)
Source title: Lecture Notes in Engineering and Computer Science
Affiliations: Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University11480, Indonesia; Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University11480, Indonesia; Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University11480, Indonesia; Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Johan, Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University11480, Indonesia; Kurniawan, Y., Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University11480, Indonesia; Jingga, F., Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University11480, Indonesia; Limantara, N., Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University11480, Indonesia
Abstract: Business process simulation software designed for sales and distribution business processes using web-based platform. Business process simulation applications has two major subsystems, namely wholesale and retail sales. The business activities that will be developed in the business process simulation system are the incoming inquiries, sales orders, delivery and billing. In addition there is also a part of the procurement cycle such as purchase orders. With this software, the students will be able directly interact with the simulation systems and business process practice has been applied to the industry. In this application there are some additional features that support simulation analysis, such as wholesale analysis and billing list generation process. And there are also features related reporting process such as purchase order reports, reports of wholesale and retail sales orders, profits and loss, cash flow, balance sheet and capital reports. We hope through research and development of this system, the students will get an overview of the actual business process-related business processes of sales, distribution, and business workflow in the company. By creating a business process simulation applications, we hope this application can help students to learn the business processes of sales and distribution processes more effectively.
Author Keywords: Business process; Information systems; Learning activities; Simulation; Systems design
Index Keywords: Computer software; File organization; Information systems; Purchasing; Students; Systems analysis; Business activities; Business Process; Business process simulation; Learning Activity; Research and development; Sales and distribution; Simulation; Simulation analysis; Sales

Authors: Ongowarsito H., Candra S., Johan, Wirawan C.
Title: Knowledge management function design in PT X
Source title: Pertanika Journal of Social Sciences and Humanities
Affiliations: School of Business Management, Bina Nusantara University, Palmerah Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Microsoft Indonesia, Palmerah Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Ongowarsito, H., School of Business Management, Bina Nusantara University, Palmerah Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Candra, S., School of Business Management, Bina Nusantara University, Palmerah Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Johan, School of Business Management, Bina Nusantara University, Palmerah Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Wirawan, C., Microsoft Indonesia, Palmerah Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: The purpose of this research is to provide understanding of knowledge management function in PT X for technical account managers in premier delivery, improving business processes, pooling redundant tasks and simplifying onboarding processes. The analysis and modelling method used was in accordance with ITIL v3 (2011), one of the most widely used IT management tools. It was found that employees experiencing work overload can benefit greatly from the establishment of knowledge management. Previously, there was limited knowledge management in PT X, and also, it was not specific to the needs of PT X. Expected results of this research were a change in process and establishment of a new function within PT X. This project will benefit users in improving processes, gathering and distributing knowledge and offloading some amount of workload experienced by technical account managers in PT X by using knowledge management. © 2016 Universiti Putra Malaysia Press.

Title: Development of E-Learning for social communities using the content management system to support information management activities (A case study approach)
Affiliations: Bina Nusantara University, Jl KH Syahdan No 9, Kemanggisan, Jakarta Barat  11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Kurniawan, Y., Bina Nusantara University, Jl KH Syahdan No 9, Kemanggisan, Jakarta Barat  11480, Indonesia; Chandra, A.N., Bina Nusantara University, Jl KH Syahdan No 9, Kemanggisan, Jakarta Barat  11480, Indonesia; Johan, Bina Nusantara University, Jl KH Syahdan No 9, Kemanggisan, Jakarta Barat  11480, Indonesia
Abstract: This paper aims to design a model of e-learning for social community, it can be developed into a website using content management system for information management, so it can facilitate social communities to exchange information, online learning, search and manage data, set the life cycle and personalize the website, so it can produce information more accurate, timely, relevant, reliable and ultimately improve the quality of information from social communities. Development activities in this research: starting with the analysis, design and implementing e-Learning Application Model for Social Community. © 2016 American Scientific Publishers All rights reserved.

Authors: Kurniawan Y., Johan, Halim E., Hartono H.
Title: Knowledge management systems for Information Technology operations center
Source title: Lecture Notes in Engineering and Computer Science
Affiliations: Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University11480, Indonesia; Management Department, School of Business Management, Bina Nusantara University11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Kurniawan, Y., Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University11480, Indonesia; Johan, Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University11480, Indonesia; Halim, E., Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University11480, Indonesia; Hartono, H., Management Department, School of Business Management, Bina Nusantara University11480, Indonesia
Abstract: Information Technology Operation Center (ITOC). is the one division in Information Technology Department for XYZ company. This division responsibility to maintain and improve Information Technology services and operations in XYZ company. The major problem in this company is the number of employee turnover. It is become the obstacles for the company to keep the knowledge in the company, because the majority employees are outsourced. The company need a knowledge management systems as a solution to keep the knowledge of employees in the company (capable of storing, distributing knowledge, and maintaining corporate knowledge). The system design of this paper used SECI model method by Nonaka and Takeuchi and Object Oriented Analysis and Design method.
Index Keywords: Design; Human resource management; Knowledge acquisition; Knowledge based systems; Knowledge management; Object oriented programming; Analysis; Corporate knowledge; Information technology departments; Information technology services; Knowledge management system; Object oriented analysis and design; Operations centers; System; Information management
